newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan's Dewan Salman rises 2.86 pct.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan's Dewan Salman rises 2.86 pct.

text.p: Pakistan polyester-maker Dewan Salman Fibre Ltd rose 1.10 rupees, or 2.86 percent, to 39.60 on Monday on buying by speculators after the government promised an industry-boosting package, dealers said.
Some 1.18 million shares were traded in the morning on the Karachi Stock Exchange, one dealer said.

The dealer said Dewan Salman's profitability was likely to rise after an expected cut in tariffs on raw material imports. This should boost sales by making locally-produced polyester staple fibre cheaper than imported fibre.
